New Records: Sunil Chhetri retired as the fourth highest goal-scorer in international football.
Key Match Events: Sunil Chhetri retired from international football as India played out a goalless draw against Kuwait.
A mini-brawl between Edmund and a Kuwait international with Sultan Alenezi stepping in between the two players resulted in a yellow card.
Rahim Ali showcased brilliant skill but the defenders cleared his pass inside the box.
Gurpreet made a crucial save from a narrow angle shot by Kuwait.
Al-Rashidi came close to scoring for Kuwait but his shot was not up to the mark.
Chhangte and Samad were notable for their offensive efforts for India.
Pre-Game Insights: The match held special importance for head coach Igor Stimac due to recent losses.
A win over Kuwait would take India into the next round of the World Cup qualifiers.
Sunil Chhetri's last game was highlighted as an emotional moment for Indian football.
The match was seen as a crucial step for India to enter the final-18 stage of the World Cup qualifiers.
Post-Match Reflections: Sunil Chhetri's farewell was an emotional moment for the entire stadium.
India will need to win their next game against Qatar to qualify for the next round.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Salt Lake Stadium in Kolkata.
The game ended in a 0-0 draw with both teams having good chances but unable to convert them.
